definition[0]: to do something wrong or spoil something by making mistakes
example[0]: We can’t afford to foul up this time.
example[1]: Glen completely fouled up the seating arrangements.
definition[1]: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
example[2]: He lit a cigarette and started to foul up the air with stinging yellow smoke.
definition[2]: a problem caused by a stupid or careless mistake
